block.p: Katherine Schuyler Seal, a daughter of Susan and David Seal of Hartsdale, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher Nye Pinkham, a son of Marion Pinkham and Dr. Gordon Pinkham of Bedford, N.Y. Msgr. John J. Scanlon performed the ceremony at the Immaculate Heart of Mary Church in Scarsdale, N.Y.

Mrs. Pinkham, 25, is an account executive in New York with the advertising sales department of About.com, a Web site. She graduated from the University of New Hampshire. Her father is an adjunct professor at the Stern School of Business at New York University. He retired as a senior vice president for account management at BBDO Worldwide, the advertising agency in New York. The bride's mother is a broker with Julia B. Fee, a real estate company in Scarsdale.

Katherine Schuyler Seal, a daughter of Susan and David Seal of Hartsdale, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher Nye Pinkham, a son of Marion Pinkham and Dr. Gordon Pinkham of Bedford, N.Y. Msgr. John J. Scanlon performed the ceremony at the Immaculate Heart of Mary Church in Scarsdale, N.Y.

Mrs. Pinkham, 25, is an account executive in New York with the advertising sales department of About.com, a Web site. She graduated from the University of New Hampshire. Her father is an adjunct professor at the Stern School of Business at New York University. He retired as a senior vice president for account management at BBDO Worldwide, the advertising agency in New York. The bride's mother is a broker with Julia B. Fee, a real estate company in Scarsdale.

The bridegroom, 27, is a commodity options trader on the New York Board of Trade. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother is an assistant to the dean and academic adviser to evening students at Mercy College in White Plains. His father is a freelance writer of computer software instructions.
